tool.name: BiobbCurves
tool.description: : Wrapper for the Cur+ executable that is part of the Curves+ software suite.

param.name: input_struc_path
param.label: input TRJ,PDB,NETCDF,NC file
param.help: Trajectory or PDB input file. Format: [input].[format]

param.name: input_top_path
param.label: input TOP file
param.help: Topology file, needed along with .trj file (optional). Format: [input].top

param.name: outname_output_cda_path
param.label: output CDA name
param.help: Filename for Curves+ output .cda file Format: [output].cda

param.name: outname_output_lis_path
param.label: output LIS name
param.help: Filename for Curves+ output .lis file Format: [output].lis

param.name: outname_output_zip_path
param.label: output ZIP name
param.help: Filename for .zip files containing Curves+ output that is not .cda or .lis files Format: [output].zip

param.name: sele
param.label: Take tool settings:
param.help: Select where tool settings are to be read from

param.name: properties
param.label: Configuration file
param.help: File containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: jsonstr
param.label: JSON string
param.help: JSON string containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: s1range
param.label: s1range
param.help: Range of first strand. Must be specified in the form "start:end".

param.name: s2range
param.label: s2range
param.help: Range of second strand. Must be specified in the form "start:end".

param.name: stdlib_path
param.label: stdlib_path
param.help: Path to Curves' standard library files for nucleotides. If not specified will look for 'standard' files in current directory.

param.name: itst
param.label: itst
param.help: Iteration start index.

param.name: itnd
param.label: itnd
param.help: Iteration end index.

param.name: itdel
param.label: itdel
param.help: Iteration delimiter.

param.name: ions
param.label: ions
param.help: If True, helicoidal analysis of ions (or solvent molecules) around solute is carried out.

param.name: test
param.label: test
param.help: If True, provide addition output in .lis file on fitting and axis generation.

param.name: line
param.label: line
param.help: if True, find the best linear helical axis.

param.name: fit
param.label: fit
param.help: if True, fit a standard bases to the input coordinates (important for MD snapshots to avoid base distortions leading to noisy helical parameters).

param.name: axfrm
param.label: axfrm
param.help: if True, generates closely spaced helical axis frames as input for Canal and Canion.

param.name: binary_path
param.label: binary_path
param.help: Path to Curves+ executable, otherwise the program wil look for Cur+ executable in the binaries folder.
